clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Motivational Interviewing in Improving Oral Hygiene in Orthodontic Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether motivational interviewing is effective in improving oral hygiene in orthodontic patients wearing fixed appliances.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess change in oral hygiene using plaque index Löe & Silness
primary_outcome.description: Plaque index Löe & Silness (Time: baseline, 1 month and 6 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess change in oral hygiene using gingival index Löe & Silness
secondary_outcome.description: Gingival index Löe & Silness ( Time: baseline, 1 month and 6 months)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Oral hygiene counseling and motivational interviewing
arm_group.description: This group will receive a session of oral hygiene counseling and a single session of motivational interviewing to increase the readiness of change.

intervention.arm_group_label: Oral hygiene counseling and motivational interviewing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Orthodontic patients wearing fixed appliances, within the first six months of treatment
- Eruption completed (except for the third molars) or late mixed dentition.
- Caucasian
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Periodontal disease
- Systemic illness
- Medical treatment

reference.citation: Martins RK, McNeil DW. Review of Motivational Interviewing in promoting health behaviors. Clin Psychol Rev. 2009 Jun;29(4):283-93. doi: 10.1016/j.cpr.2009.02.001. Epub 2009 Feb 23. Review.
